page.title: 18The Game Keeper 2
page.content: The fun of stalking is to get as close as possible before you shoot the deer(about 100 yards). Some people say that you can get a better shot at it from above but our keeper says it is just as good to crawl from below. When they go to weigh it they take the belly out and that is what they call larder condition. Today there is a lot of forestry which spreads the deer. The keeper thinks there are not as many deer now than what there were ten years ago. The game keeper stocks the river by putting 50 000 eyed ova salmon in the river each year to help natural stock. The predators that kill the fish are heron, eel, seal, Brown trout, Mergansers, Goosanders, Cormorants and Mink. The game keeper can't do any thing about them.
